page.title: 06Hill Soils & Grasses: FINTRY
page.content:
The quality of the soil and its grass cover effects the number of stock that can be fed and therefore the farmer.
The{Fintry Hills}and {Campsie Fells} rise steeply from the Endrick valley at Fintry. On the slopes the{soil}is mainly{mineral}with{blanket peat}on the tops.
The mineral soils are good for hill farms. Many of the better areas were cultivated in the crofting days of 150 years ago. These have been reseeded in the past 30 years, with modern grasses and clover. This has greatly increased their stock carrying capacity.
{Indigenous grasses:}Agrostis/Fescue and Malinia caerulea and wild clover.{ {Newer varieties include:}Timothy, Perenial Rye Grass and Meadow Fescue.
